commit.message:
Complete binding pattern support for module var declaration
Add list, error, mapping binding pattern support for module level var declaration in node transformer
Make expr and equal token optional in formatter

Fix language server core failure

Compiler FE support for module list binding pattern
Add Compiler FE support for module list binding pattern, use VariableNode to hold global variables in the package, update test cases
Test cases for module var declaration with list binding pattern
Use missingNodesHelper to create name for missing simple variable

nodes.bodyText: Shall we extract this logic out to a method?

With this we are changing the order in which different constructs are desugared, right? Hope this wouldn't cause issues in serviceDesugar, annotationDesugar, etc.
For example, in the annotation desugar we populate a global map variable. Wonder if it still gets rewritten after this change. Can you try several different scenarios and validate?
Shall we directly call modVarDeclrNode.initializer() in L592 instead? We don't seem to be using this variable elsewhere.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              only simple variables are allowed to be isolated
          
          
            
              only a simple variable can be marked as ''isolated''

nodes.bodyText: How is this not an issue for other non-rest binding patterns? Rather than specifically checking here, I think we should try and set this initFunctionEnv before getting here.

If we are going with this approach, IMO we should bring the (BLangSimpleVariable) parentTupleVariable.restVariable != null check out of createRestFieldVarDefStmts and check that first before changing the env unnecessarily.
Yeah, I think it's better to maintain the previous order. Or the desugaring here can result in unexpected results in these phases.
Instead of introducing a global variable shall we check if it possible to move this desugarGlobalVariables and use the env from there?
Unnecessary new line?
Don't we have to implement this similar to BLangSimpleVariable?
Is there an issue for this?
Can't we make this work with BVarSymbol instead of introducing a new kind of symbol just for this?
